turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Where's that cheery face we've come to know and love?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: You call me in on my day off because some idiots have broken into local Democratic Headquarters--tell me, Harry, why should I be smiling?

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: As usual, that keen mind of yours has pegged the situation perfectly.  Except  it wasn't local Democratic Headquarters, it was National Democratic Headquarters--  --and  these weren't just any idiots, these were special idiots, seeing as when they were arrested at 2:30 this morning, they were all wearing business suits and Playtex gloves and were carrying--  --a walkie-talkie, forty rolls of film, cameras, lock picks, pen-sized tear gas guns, plus various bugging devices.  Not to mention over two thousand dollars, mostly in sequenced hundred dollar bills.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Preliminary hearing at Superior Courthouse?

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Two o'clock, work the phones 'til you go.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: ...go on, go on...

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: That's everything Bachinski had, I think it's worth following up.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Don't know; who the hell's Howard Hunt?  It's probably nothing but check it out. Just go easy, it could be crazy Cubans.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: OK, get on this W.House guy and do a better job then you did on McCord.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: I did all right on McCord.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Then how come the Associated Press were the ones found out that Mr. McCord is security coordinator for the Committee to Re-elect the President, otherwise known as CREEP?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: The head of security for the reelection of a Republican President got caught bugging the national offices of the Democrats? What the hell does that mean?

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Mr. John Mitchell, the head of CREEP, says it means nothing.  "...This man and the other people involved were not operating on either our behalf or with our consent. These is no place in our campaign or in the electoral process for this type of activity, and we will not forget it or condone it."

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: You can't believe that.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: As a rough rule of thumb, as far as I can throw Bronco Nagurski, that's how much I trust John Mitchell...

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: What'd you get on W.House?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Lotsa hints--

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: I can't sell hints to Simons--  --you called everyone you know?  Call someone you don't know.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Who's Charles Colson?

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: I would liken your query to being in Russia half a century ago and asking someone, "I understand who Lenin is and Trotsky I got too, but who's this yokel Stalin?"

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Who's Colson, Harry?

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: The most powerful man in America is President Nixon, probably you've heard his name.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: The second most powerful man is Robert Haldeman. Just below him are a trio: Mr. Erlichman is Haldeman's friend, and they protect the President from everybody which is why they are referred to as either The German Shepherds or the Berlin Wall. Mr. Mitchell we've already discussed. Mr. Colson is the President's special counsel.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Thanks, Harry.  Know anything about Colson?

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Just that on his office wall there's a cartoon with a caption reading, "When you've got them by the balls, their hearts and minds will follow."

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Whaddya got, whaddya got?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Hunt is Colson's man--  --that's Charles Colson, Nixon's special counsel--  --they both went to Brown University--  --Hunt worked for the C.I.A. till '70, and this is on deep background, the FBI thinks he's involved with the break-in.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: I never asked them about Watergate. I only said what were Hunt's duties at the White House. They volunteered that he was innocent when nobody asked was he guilty.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: I think we got a White House consultant linked to the bugging.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: --who you got?--

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: --well, Sloan--

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: Anything?

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Woodward's onto a new wrinkle with the break-in thing--absolute page one stuff--

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: --in other words, you got nothing, you're thumbsucking.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Could develop.

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: Let me see what you get, but don't jump--The New York Times thinks it's crazy Cubans.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: I can predict the next words you're gonna say: "anyone but Bernstein."  I want to send a reporter to Miami.

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: Anyone but Bernstein.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: Howard--

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: --remember Toronto, Harry.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: That was awhile ago.

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: I don't get it--you were the one who wanted to fire him.

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: I know, I did, but damnit Howard--  For the first time since I've known him, I think he's really humping...

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: --has any of them got an ax?--

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: --political, personal, sexual, anything at all against Mitchell?--

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: --listen, we didn't make them do these things--once they did, it's our job to report it--

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: --go over your sources again--

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: --listen, I love this country, you think I want to bring it down?--I'm not some goddamn zany, I was a hawk--

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: --Harry, weren't you just arguing the opposite way?--

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: --maybe I'm tense--

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: More denunciations?

turns.speaker: ROSENFELD
turns.text: One Senator just gave a speech slurring us 57 times in 20 minutes.

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: What else have you got?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: According to White House personnel, Hunt definitely works there as a consultant for Colson. But when I called the White House Press office, they said he hadn't worked there for three months. Then the P.R. guy said the weirdest thing to me.  "I am convinced that neither Mr. Colson nor anyone else at the White House had any knowledge of, or participation in, this deplorable incident at the Democratic National Committee."

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: Isn't that what you'd expect them to say?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: --can we use their names?--

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: What do you think Mrs. Graham wants to see me for?

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: Maybe to fire you--since you two started on this story, the Post stock has dropped, what, 50 percent?  And the word is some Nixon people are challenging her TV licenses. I'm not saying she's going on relief, but I don't think it's unreasonable for her to want to meet you.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: You think she wants us to ease up on the story?

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: I don't know, but I don't think that's unreasonable either, do you?

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: --which Young?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Larry Young, a California lawyer--

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: --and he says Chapin hired Segretti--

turns.speaker: SIMONS
turns.text: --well and good, but when will he say it on the record.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: He just did.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Mr. Sloan?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: My wife told me to expect you.  As you know, I haven't talked to the press.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I'd like to talk to you, I really would, but my lawyers say I shouldn't until after the Watergate trial.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: You handed out the money. Maybe there's a legitimate explanation for the way it was done--

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Does "they" mean the White House?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: As opposed to the Committee? The Committee's not an independent operation. Everything is cleared with the White House. I don't think that the FBI or the prosecutors understand that.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: The report on the cash in Maurice Stans' safe, the three hundred fifty thousand, that's true?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: No. It was closer to seven hundred thousand.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: And as treasurer, you could release those funds?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: When so ordered.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: We're not sure we've got all the guys who could order you, but we know there were five.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Colson's too smart to get directly involved with something like that.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Haldeman.  Right?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I won't talk about the other two.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I can't say anything, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: One thing I'm not completely clear on--when you gave out the money to Liddy, how did that work?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Badly.  You don't realize how close all this came to staying undiscovered--I gave Liddy the Dahlberg check and he gave it to Barker who took it to Miami and deposited it.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Go on.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Well, when Liddy came and asked for money for what turned out to be the break-in funds, I went to the safe and gave him--out of this whole fortune--I happened to give him the same hundreds he gave me--banks have to keep track of hundreds. If the money had been in fifties, or if I'd grabbed a different stack, there probably wouldn't have been any Watergate story.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: A boy or a girl?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: A girl. Melissa.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: --and it wasn't Ehrlichman or Colson or the President.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: No, none of those.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: --look, when the Watergate grand jury questioned you, did you name names?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Of course--everything they asked--

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: Hi. I'm Bob Woodward of the Washington Post and I hate to bother you at home--

turns.speaker: SWEET OLD LADY
turns.text: --I already get the Post. I don't need another subscription.

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: No, I'm a reporter. I wanted to talk to you about the Committee to Re- Elect.

turns.speaker: SWEET OLD LADY
turns.text: The what to what?

turns.speaker: WOODWARD
turns.text: You work there, Miss Abbott.

turns.speaker: SWEET OLD LADY
turns.text: I'm not Miss Abbott.

turns.speaker: CHOIR TEACHER
turns.text: What the hell was that?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: CHOIR TEACHER
turns.text: No, it was good.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Oh, well...  It came from the heart.

turns.speaker: CHOIR TEACHER
turns.text: Well then keep it coming.  Alright, people, good work!  Keep it up and we'll do great at the state competition.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I'll do it.

turns.speaker: CHOIR TEACHER
turns.text: Okay then.  The rest of you okay with that?

turns.speaker: COACH MARSHALL
turns.text: Good work, Ostreicher.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Thanks coach.

turns.speaker: COACH MARSHALL
turns.text: You're a killer, Ozzy!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: -- Thanks, coach --

turns.speaker: COACH MARSHALL
turns.text: Christ!  I didn't say you were out of the game!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Sorry, coach.

turns.speaker: COACH MARSHALL
turns.text: What the fuck is this?  You got someplace more important to be?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Great evening, isn't it?

turns.speaker: COLLEGE CHICK
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: There's something about the spring that's just cool.  Like the smell of fresh rain or something.

turns.speaker: COLLEGE CHICK
turns.text: What did you just say?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Suck me...beautiful?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Uh...you know, my friends call me Nova -- as in Casanova.

turns.speaker: COLLEGE CHICK
turns.text: You need some work, buddy!

turns.speaker: COLLEGE CHICK
turns.text: Look, Chris.  There are just some things you need to learn, that's all.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: COLLEGE CHICK
turns.text: Alright, well...you've got to tone it down.  You don't need to go to Lookout Point and spout cheeseball lines to be romantic.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: ...okay...

turns.speaker: COLLEGE CHICK
turns.text: You have to pay attention to a girl. Be sensitive to her feelings. Relationships are reciprocal.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I'm not good in math.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Perhaps you should consider actually answering an ad.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Finch, you can be the one to date a nearly-dead insane chick.  Eat your damn imitation hot dog.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: This is no imitation.  Removing the hot dog from the Ultradog yields a better dog.  Behold -- Ultradog, no dog.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Good morning gentleman.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Finch!  Where were you last night? What happened to the foolproof plan?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: I thought a fashionably late entrance would enhance my appearance.  When I got here, the Bacchanalia was over and the nymphs had left.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You're just gonna sit there and drink your coffee?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Mochaccino.  Actually, in the spirit of the pact, I do need to ask for your cooperation in one small matter.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Finch, don't you think it's about time you learned to take a dump at school?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: When was the last time you looked at the facilities here?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Ah, Stifler's mom!  Thank you for letting us have a great party.

turns.speaker: STIFLER'S MOM
turns.text: As if there were any alternative in the matter.  Are you enjoying yourself?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: I'm three sheets to the wind, ma'am!

turns.speaker: STIFLER'S MOM
turns.text: I'm so happy for you.  Takes the edge off, doesn't it?  And where might your date be?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Oh no, no date.  Bathroom incident.

turns.speaker: STIFLER'S MOM
turns.text: Pardon me?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: ...Nevermind.  You have anything to drink?

turns.speaker: STIFLER'S MOM
turns.text: I believe the kegs are upstairs.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: No, no, that's what the cretins drink. I mean alcohol, liquor -- good stuff.

turns.speaker: STIFLER'S MOM
turns.text: All right, I got some scotch.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Single malt?

turns.speaker: STIFLER'S MOM
turns.text: Aged eighteen years.  Why don't you get the glasses.  Behind the bar.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: So...would you object if I said you're quite striking?

turns.speaker: STIFLER'S MOM
turns.text: Mister Finch -- are you trying to seduce me?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Yes ma'am, I am.

turns.speaker: STIFLER'S MOM
turns.text: I had no idea you'd be this good!

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Neither did I!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: This is your plan, Finch?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: This.  Right now.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Of course, Finch.  What?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Whatever you hear about me, you agree.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: What are we gonna hear?

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: You'll see.  Gotta go.  Sixteen minute round trip.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You know, Jim...you could go back there...and...

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Seduce her.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: What do you suppose they're saying?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: No idea.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Finch!  Get to the bathroom!  Now!

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Easy, tiger.  What's in there?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Just go!

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Why is this?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You're gonna shit your pants!

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Charming.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Finch, listen -- Stifler slipped some sort of laxative in your Mocash-chino or whatever.  It's fast acting.  I mean <u>really</u> fast.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: First of all, it's <u>Mocha</u>ccino, and secondly...Oohhhh!

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: Me too.  For the most part.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Nah.  Fuck, you guys are right, I don't know what I'm doing.  I mean I'm acting like I've got it all together tonight.  But I know Vicky is gonna ask me if I love her.  And I don't know what I'm gonna say.  So now it's like, maybe I'll just wimp out on the whole thing.

turns.speaker: FINCH
turns.text: I'll tell you, I've learned one thing: women, like wine, get better with age.  Of course, I have no frame of reference for this comparison.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: So Oz, you almost made it, huh?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Not bad, Chris.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Really?  Hey, thanks -- Heather, right?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Yeah...so...you've got this sort of... Bobby McFerrin thing going there.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Yeah.  Right, uh-huh.  I feel like I've discovered this whole new side of me.  Music is so expressive.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Okay.  I mean, I agree, but...aren't you supposed to be out, like, trying to decapitate someone with your lacrosse stick or something?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Oh sure.  I know what people think. It's like, Oz, he's just this kickass lacrosse player -- I also play football, by the way -- But that's like...not <u>all</u> that I am.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Of course, I didn't --

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I mean it really bothers me when people try to pigeonhole me like that.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You?  You think I don't get that? God, it's like just because I don't get drunk and barf every weekend, people say "Oh, here's this goody-two- shoes choir-girl priss."

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Yeah...so like, what else <u>do</u> you do?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Well the same things you do.  Hang out with friends and stuff, you know, whatever.  What do you think I do?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I just -- realized that I didn't know anything about you.  I was interested.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oh...well that's okay.  Cool.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Hey, what're you doing here?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Just enjoying my exhilarating first lacrosse experience.  You like, "kicked butt."

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Um...Chris --

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You can call me Oz.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Do I have to?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You can call me Ostreicher.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What's your middle name?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Come on!  I won't tell.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Neither will I.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Okay.  So I had this...thought, and...this may seem like it's out of left field, and I don't know if you can, but since I'm not going with anyone --

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Alright, cool.  I gotta hit the showers, but...I think this'll be really good.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Yeah, me too, okay, cool.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Nice car.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: I'm glad you think so.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You don't like it?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: No, I like the car.  By the way, though, about prom?  That was like a bad idea.  Sorry I invited you.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oh, please.  I asked you because I thought you might actually be worth going with.  But you are just a jock. No wait.  You're a jerk.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: What?  No I'm not.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: I saw you making fun of me with your lacrosse buddies.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I wasn't making fun of you.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Give me a break, you're so full of it.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Because I want to.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Yeah?  Well you can't fake your way through this.  You better practice.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Hi...

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: How did you know I was here?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Stifler told me.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You talked to Stifler?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Well...I needed to find you.  We are gonna have to practice that song.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: ...okay.  Cool then.  I'm um, I'm glad you came by.  I mean, really.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Uh...my dad's the manager.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Really?  Cool.  Tell him his subs are great.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Ah, he's always too heavy on the vinegar.  If you really want a good one, you gotta let me make it.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: My dad's always here running the store, busy and stuff...and I fill in once a week so he can get a night off.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: That's nice.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: So you're going to Michigan?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Yeah, well my parents wanted me to go to Northwestern.  I didn't want to write all those extra essays they make you do -- I mean, how am I supposed to know what my "most emotionally significant moment" was?  So when my U of M acceptance came in December, I said the hell with it.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Onions?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You want onions?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  So what're you gonna major in?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Well, State's got a good business school.  And I can probably walk onto the lacrosse team.  Green peppers?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Yeah.  So wow, you've got it figured out.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Well, I mean, business is okay, and lacrosse is awesome, but what am I gonna be, a pro lacrosse player?  I really have no idea.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oh thank God, I thought I was the only one.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Well, you're not.  Oil and vinegar?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Yeah.  You know, people are always like, "What're you gonna major in?" And I don't know.  And they're like, "You'll figure it out."  Yeah?  When?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I know.  Salt and pepper?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: So we're gonna be close next year?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You -- oh, you mean -- yeah, East Lansing and Ann Arbor.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: ...yeah.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: ...I've got this lacrosse game.  It's really important, it's our last game. And you know, Central almost beat us last time, so I really want to kick their ass, and it's like cool because we're gonna get to play at State, which means that after the game I might be able to stop by...

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You can't sing at the competition.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I'm sorry, I totally spaced.  I just...I didn't realize it...

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: ...it's okay, you should do whatever makes you happy.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Alright...yeah...thanks for understanding.  So I guess...I'll see you later.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What about the game?!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I'm not playing.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You're missing the game for us?!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: No.  I'm missing the game for you.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: There's something I've been meaning to tell you, Heather.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: It's gonna sound really bad, but I want you to know.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: This isn't the best way to proposition me.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: No, that's not what I mean.  I mean -- look.  You know what made me leave that game?  Coach was giving this speech, about not slacking off when you see the opportunity to score.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: This isn't any better, Chris.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: No, see Heather, what I realized is that...with you, it's not like I'm running towards the goal, trying to figure out the best way to score.  And this may sound corny, but --

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oz, it's okay, I know.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You called me Oz.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Well, that's what your friends call you.  I mean...I feel like I'm one of your friends now...and also...your girlfriend.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Hmm.  You know that's  really a shitty middle name!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I know, it sucks!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I can't think of anything to say that's not cheesy.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Then don't.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Vanderbilt's not that far from U of M.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Yeah right.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: What?  We both have cars.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Yeah but, no offense, you're talking about a post-high school, long- distance relationship, and you and Kevin haven't even done it yet.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: That's not why we're going out.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: What the hell are you expecting him to drive to Vanderbilt for?  Milk and cookies?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Jessica!  He'll drive there for me, and I'll drive to Ann Arbor for him. We're going to have sex when he's ready and I'm ready.  It's got to be completely perfect.  I want the right place, the right time, the right moment.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Vicky, it's not a space shuttle launch, it's sex.  So did you do the physics write-up?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: He likes it.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Of course he does.  What about you? Have you just never had one with Kevin -- or have you never had one, period?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: I think I've had one.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Well that's a no.  No wonder you're not psyched about sex.  You've never even had one manually?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: ...I've never tried it.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Are you kidding?  You've never double- clicked your mouse?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Jessica, can you drive me home?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Ah, you'll get her back soon enough. That's easy, she likes you.  What you need to do is learn to press a girl's buttons.  You gotta give her what she's never had.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I'll give you a hint.  "Ohhh, yeah, yeah!"  Comprende?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You mean...and orgasm?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: You got it, stud.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Well...I'm pretty sure I've --

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: No you haven't.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: But that one time --

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Well of course I'd want to give her that.  I mean, what do you think, I don't care about her?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Do you love her?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I -- I don't know, you can't ask me that.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Well, if you want to get her in the sack, tell her you love her.  That's how I was duped.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I don't want to dupe her, Jessica.  If I say it, I have to be sure I mean it.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Well it's up to you.  The Big L, or the Big O.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: No comment.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: No comment?!  Are you kidding me?! I've never seen someone's image change so...so drastically!

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Thanks.  It was my idea.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Did you guys hook up or something?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Are you kidding?  No.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Then what the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Well...I guess it's okay for me to tell you now.  That reputation of his isn't going anywhere.  Finch comes to me and says, "Jessica, I need help with this, blah blah, etcetera."  So I told him, pay me two- hundred bucks, and I'll tell a couple girls that you're dynamite in bed.  So he did, and I did.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I don't get it, that really works?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Duh.  Of course.  Naturally, I embellished a little bit.  Hey, did you hear that Finch had sex with an older woman?

turns.speaker: PORNO-CHANNEL CHICK
turns.text: Oooh, yeah.  Oh, baby, you're so good.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, I'm the best, baby.

turns.speaker: PORNO-CHANNEL CHICK
turns.text: Give it to me!  Yes!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh yeah, baby, I'll give it to you.

turns.speaker: PORNO-CHANNEL CHICK
turns.text: Don't you love my sexy body?!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I do, baby, I do.

turns.speaker: PORNO-CHANNEL CHICK
turns.text: You're so big!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, that's right.

turns.speaker: PORNO-CHANNEL CHICK
turns.text: Fuck me!  Yes!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Uh...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: And you said...

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Nothing, I just hugged her back.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You think she was serious?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I couldn't tell -- She could've meant like, "I love you grandma" or "I love you Vanderbilt."

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: There's our man.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Finch, you got the Latin homework?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Unlisted age, plus "youthful mind," equals old.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No, "Charming" is old.  "Older" is <u>really</u> old.  "Youthful mind" is dead.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Alright...I'm shooting for a nine o'clock ETA.  Beer in hand by five after.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You can crash at Stifler's?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: It's all good.  Breath check.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: At least now I know what the hell they're saying.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So, does my hair look better --  like this, or...  like this?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What about you?  You're the one with the girlfriend and you're still stranded on third base.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You know, I've never got that shit. What exactly constitutes third base?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Gotta go.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Ow, what the hell?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Sorry, I thought you were dead.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Like a bet?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: No, a <u>pact</u>.  No money involved.  This is more important than any bet.  Now here's the deal: We all get laid before we graduate.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That's what we are, we keep each other on track.  Prior to this day, we've postured.  We've procrastinated. We've pretended.  We've -- well I can't think of other p-words, but we've probably done them too.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Pontificated.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Separately, we are flawed and vulnerable.  But together, we are the masters of our sexual destiny!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Their tiger-style kung-fu is strong; but our dragon style will defeat it!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, it's like tradition or something.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Right.  That gives us...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Exactly three weeks to the day.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I have no idea.  Finch showers in a bathing suit.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: No -- it's true.  He is...really... big.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, enormous.
